thread.title: Man United move ahead of Barcelona in race for £70m star: Red Devils open talks
thread.title_full: Man United move ahead of Barcelona in race for £70m star: Red Devils open talks

title: Man United move ahead of Barcelona in race for £70m star: Red Devils open talks
text:
1 of 11 Click through the gallery for the most bizarre snaps from Old Trafford 
However, a transfer for Silva won’t come cheap with a fee of around £70m touted as his current contract runs out in 2020. 
United face competition from Barcelona for the Portugal international though, and have been keeping tabs on him. 
Barcelona’s technical director Robert Fernandez reportedly watched him in Monaco’s 3-0 win over Nice on Saturday. GETTY Jose Mourinho is a big fan of Bernardo SIlva GETTY Manchester United have reportedly opened talks with Monaco over Bernardo Silva 
But the Red Devils seem to be moving ahead of their Spanish rivals with negotiations underway. 
If United are unsuccessful in their attempts to sign him permanently in the summer, they will try to negotiate a first refusal option should they decide to sell. 
Silva has scored seven goals in all competitions for Monaco this season. Related articles
